question.title: Hide inner classes as separate files in Project View in IntelliJ IDEA
question.body:
I'm facing an issue with IntelliJ IDEA where it displays classes contained within a Java file as separate nodes in the Project View, rather than showing just the single .java file.

Problem: In my Project panel, for a Java file that contains multiple classes, I see:

  • Main.java (file)
    • Learn (class contained in the file)
    • Main (class contained in the file)

What I want:

  • Just see "Main.java" as a single file entry
  • Don't want to see the individual classes listed separately underneath

answers.body: This is not currently possible. See this IntelliJ Platform issue: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IJPL-48763/Project-Windows-Project-Files-view-also-shows-inner-classes

question_comments.body: @Holger I agree with you. IntelliJ behaves differently, unfortunately. I don't know why OP wants those classes not to be shown. Mine is just a supposition. Maybe they'll update their question after seeing the comments.

@dani-vta if that’s the case, the OP should have written it that way, i.e. “How can I make IntelliJ open the file on double click rather than expanding the node?” Maybe, there’s a direct solution to that specific problem. The OP just has to ask… (Side note: in Eclipse, this works exactly as someone would expect, the file always opens on double click and only unfolds on >)

@Holger I think the problem OP is having with it is that when you double-click on the item in the project view with multiple top-level classes, IntelliJ doesn't open the file but just unfolds the item. You need to click on the individual top-level class to open the file in the editor. If I have to guess, the behavior appears to be quite annoying to OP.

Just klick on that ˇ symbol. It will turn into > and you won’t see nodes below the .java file. The next time you don’t want to see nodes below a specific tree node, don’t unfold it in the first place.

Also, if you hid any top-level class whose name is different from the file's, how could IntelliJ show them in the project tree? They would be completely invisible. At that point, people should guess that within a file there might be other classes besides the one with the file's name.
btw I cannot see neither HelloWorld nor Account in posted screenshot :-) I can also only see one file Main.java as a single file. I am not sure what is meant by "single file entry" in this question

I'm just noticing now that in your code you do not have different inner classes declared in your Main class, but different top-level classes declared within the same file. Those are two very different things. You should update your question accordingly.
In your Project view panel, click the gear icon in the top-right corner (it's the "Show Options Menu"). Find the option labeled Show Inner Classes and uncheck it. Have you tried it?
